Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Fallaxidin 4.1 (natural AMPs; UCLL1; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: the Eastern dwarf tree frogLitoria fallax, Australia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Moderately active (MIC 12-100 uM) against L. lactis and streptococcus uberis.SAR:  Interestingly, C-terminal amidation increased antibacterial activity by ~4-fold, indicating the important role of positive charge (Sherman PJ et al., 2009 Biochemistry 48: 11892-901. DOI: 10.1021).Structure:  The amidated peptide adopts a distorted helical structure in DPC micelles. Solid-state NMR analysis reveals the perturbation of membrane order and induces lipid domain formation in the presence of both PG and PC lipids.Updated 12/2009; 11/2024.
Literature Information.Author: Jackway RJ, Bowie JH, Bilusich D, Musgrave IF, Surinya-Johnson KH, Tyler MJ, Eichinger PC.2008
Literature Information.Title: The fallaxidin peptides from the skin secretion of the Eastern Dwarf Tree Frog Litoria fallax. Sequence determination by positive and negative ion electrospray mass spectrometry: antimicrobial activity and cDNA cloning of the fallaxidins.
